pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [fefa86b217](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22051/commits/fefa86b217e20c2c891d0015c8989c584b4bd19a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Taking a look, starting in alphabetical order

For the others, to avoid duplicating work: please comment here if you're also reviewing, so we can avoid staring at this largely mechanical diff twice. If I won't finish this tonight, I'll comment accordingly here.

Michael, thank you very much for your heroic reviewing effort!

Most of the PR has been generated by a few automated replacements.  I looked at the output of the ppRoundtrip linter, isolated some patters, inspected some regexes and then performed the replacements.  After the replacements, I spot checked a few files, to make sure that everything was in order and this is where some of the "extra" corrections came in: these were never issues with the regex, just improvements/typos.

I looked through everything: let's get this in before there are conflicts.
maintainer delegate
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

Please resolve the conflict.

bors d+

:v: adomani can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13401700210/job/37433788475)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13401700210/job/37433788887)
I just reviewed the remaining files, and the updated version of the files you changed. Another batch of suggested small tweaks - but otherwise, this looks ready!

Thanks for creating this PR! Did you do this all by hand?
According to github, I have reviewed 177 out of 260 files now. I'll try to finish the rest tonight, but would like to give you a chance to see my comments now.

In general: all changes look pretty mechanical, and the spacing fixes are clearly good. I disagree with some added periods, and have also (often, but not every time) suggested changes when the presence or absence of a period was wrong.

The rule I'm using is that a doc-string should end with a period iff it is a complete sentence. So, `/-- my favourite definition -/` is without a period, but `/-- frobnicate is better than baz because it quxes all input. -/` has one.
I just reviewed the remaining files, and the updated version of the files you changed. Another batch of suggested small tweaks - but otherwise, this looks ready!
Wow: thank you for the extensive and thorough review, Michael!
